metadata.Title: CVE-2019-25085 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A vulnerability was found in GNOME gvdb. It has been classified as critical. This affects the function gvdb_table_write_contents_async of the file gvdb-builder.c. The manipulation leads to use after free. It is possible to initiate the attack remotely. The name of the patch is d83587b2a364eb9a9a53be7e6a708074e252de14. It is recommended to apply a patch to fix this issue. The identifier VDB-216789 was assigned to this vulnerability.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-25085` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

epiphany-browser - 3.28.6-0ubuntu1
epiphany-browser-data - 3.28.6-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

libglib2.0-0 - 2.56.4-0ubuntu0.18.04.9
libglib2.0-bin - 2.56.4-0ubuntu0.18.04.9
libglib2.0-data - 2.56.4-0ubuntu0.18.04.9
libglib2.0-tests - 2.56.4-0ubuntu0.18.04.9
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> This issue was only present in gvdb for 6 days before it was fixed and didn't make its way into epiphany-browser or glib2.0 packages.

criterions.comment: epiphany-browser package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.28.6-0ubuntu1').
glib2.0 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.56.4-0ubuntu0.18.04.9').
